repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

did.abstract: Agreement between railroad carriers and labor unions, titled "Agreement of May, 1936, Washington, D. C."

defitem.label: Contact Information:
defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives Martin P. Catherwood Library 227 Ives Hall Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183> kheel_center@cornell.edu http://www.ilr.cornell.edu/library/kheel-center

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Association of American Railroads is an industry trade group representing the major railroads of North America. It was founded in 1934 after the American Railway Association merged with other industry trade groups in order to better represent and lobby for the interests of its member organizations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a copy of a Collective Bargaining Agreement between railroad carriers and the labor unions representing their employees, signed in Washington DC in May 1936.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Association of American Railroads Agreement of May 1936 #5188m. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.
